text: The men's hammer throw competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was Larry Hart of the United States. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |80.32 |Heidenheim, West Germany |August 6, 1978 |- |Pan American Games record | |66.56 |Mexico City, Mexico |1975 |} ==Results== All distances shown are in meters. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font- size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Rank !Name !Nationality !Distance !Notes |- | |Scott Neilson | |69.64 |GR |- | |Armando Orozco | |68.48 | |- | |Genovevo Morejón | |67.66 | |- |4 |Andy Bessette | |66.22 | |- |5 |José Alberto Vallejo | |59.50 | |- |6 |Daniel Gómez | |58.58 | |- |7 |Luis Martínez | |54.20 | |- |8 |Mario Egnem | |51.52 | |- | |Boris Djerassi | | | |- | |Bill Green | | | |} ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games 1979
title: Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games – Men's hammer throw
